message.content: {"id": "27869", "title": "Bug 27869: StyledText overuse of Font.getFontData", "description": "Bug 27869: The StyledText widget in Redhat 8 overuses the Font.getFontData method. This issue is exacerbated by the fact that StyledText also heavily relies on the FontMetrics API. It is recommended to cache the metric information in the StyledText widget and update it only when the font is changed.", "OB": "The Font.getFontData method is unnecessarily used by the StyledText widget when it is being typed.", "EB": "I believe, and many people agree, that the StyledText widget should not use the Font.getFontData method at all when text is being typed.", "SR": "To investigate this issue, add a System.out.println statement as the first line of the Font.getFontData method. Then, run a self-hosted Eclipse and monitor the console output. I am particularly concerned about this problem because the performance of this method is significantly poorer on some platforms, such as Motif running on UTF8."}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '27869', 'title': 'Bug 27869StyledText overuse of Font.getFontData', 'description': 'Bug 27869StyledText overuse of Font.getFontData Btw, UTF8is the default english encoding for Redhat 8.FontMetrics API is also very used by the StyledText, I believe that the metricinformation should be cached in the StyledText and update only when the font ischanged. ', 'OB': '', 'EB': "I believe, and many people agree,that this API don't need to be used at all by the StyledText when it's beentyped. ", 'SR': 'Try to add system.out.println in the first line of methodFontgetFontData, run a selfhosted eclipse, watch the console.I concerned about this problem cause in some platform the performance of thismethod is very pour if compared with Windows.For example, Motif running on UTF8. '}
